Pencil in time for nostalgic cannon duels in this hand-drawn reimagining of an old-school classic, where cannonballs fly while scribbled tumbleweeds bounce across graphite landscapes.

editorialNotes.standard: Mash through waves of foes as a heavily armed potato in this spud-tacular arena survival game.

Tiny Wings has been a longtime favorite of ours, thanks to its gentle vibe, fantastic music, and surprisingly awesome one-touch gameplay. Outrunning the sun across procedurally generated islands is rewarding and relaxing, and we love the added challenge of the four-bird race mode. The gameâ€™s vivid, vibrant colors absolutely dazzle on Apple TVâ€”we feel like weâ€™re meeting our flightless friends for the first time again.

editorialNotes.standard: Ski Safari returns with an all-new look and the same addicting gameplay. Now you can hit the slopes as Sven's sister, Evana, boot up with a snowboard, and unlock all sorts of new power-ups. To outrun an impending avalanche youâ€™ll need to crash through cabins, team up with Yetis and eagles, and perform tons of tricks. The gameplay is as fast-paced as ever, and a fresh multiplayer mode and colorful new worlds to explore (like a prehistoric volcano) will keep you cruising down these mountains for a long time.

editorialNotes.standard: True to its name, Slayin drops you into a lovingly stylized fantasy world with a single objective: eliminate monsters. Fast action, retro graphics, and a delightful chiptune soundtrack channel the high-score hysteria of old arcades, while role-playing fans will enjoy upgrading their character and customizing the game world. Six selectable heroes and multiple game modes add even more variety to this deceptively deep, wonderfully replayable experience.
A talking goat ate your grimoire! Relearn recipes by collecting reagents and tricking folks in this bewitchingly fun fairy tale.

editorialNotes.standard: The virtual Rube Goldberg machines that make up Perchangâ€™s gorgeous levels are so lovely to look at that you might forget what youâ€™re here to doâ€”move marbles into their proper pipes. With contraptions ranging from flippers to conveyer belts at your disposal, this inventive 3D puzzler requires an intoxicating mix of skill, smarts, and laser-sharp focus.

editorialNotes.short: This stylish runner made a big impact when it first launched, and it's still a blast.
editorialNotes.standard: Race through a collapsing city in a game that helped launch the infinite runner genre. From its gorgeous music to its searing imageryâ€”exploding windows, falling buildingsâ€”Canabalt overflows with style and atmosphere. Surviving even a single minute requires split-second reflexes and a whole lot of luck. Plus, after years of updatesâ€”including all-new modes like shared-screen multiplayerâ€”this already epic game has been polished to perfection.

Revenge is a dish served with epic property damage and plenty of attitude when a princess and her pet dragon decide theyâ€™re tired of getting captured. Itâ€™s pure destructive joy guiding this royal duo over (and under) a gorgeous fantasy landscape of fleeing knights, treacherous traps, and mighty bosses to smash. The game pops with personalityâ€”and its simple controls, slick level design, and upgradable equipment keep the challenge fun and fresh.

advisories: Infrequent/Mild Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References

editorialNotes.standard: Developer Jan Ilavsky came up with the idea for this gorgeous Apple Design Award winner after heâ€™d broken his arm. He started on an infinite runner that could be played one-handed, and since heâ€™s also colorblind, he added a gameplay element about changing between vibrant neon colors. Chameleon Run succeeds beautifully, balancing wicked speed with irresistible, just-one-more-try challenges.
editorialNotes.short: You'll need quick reactions in this intense polychromatic platformer.

editorialNotes.standard: With relaxed swapping rules and charming graphics, this surprisingly slick match-3 puzzler makes the genre feel fresh again.
